sentences.text: 22 Cherry Hill Drive Danvers, Massachusetts 01923

sentences.text: Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders To Be Held on August 9, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting (the Annual Meeting) of Stockholders of ABIOMED, Inc. (the Company) will be held on August 9, 2017 at 8:00 a.m. at the Mandarin Oriental, 776 Boylston Street, Boston, Massachusetts, 02199 for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect three Class I directors to our Board of Directors to serve for three-year terms extending until the 2020 Annual Meeting of Stockholders or until their successors are duly elected and qualified;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To hold an advisory vote on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To hold an advisory vote on the frequency of future Stockholder advisory votes on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To ratify the appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2018; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To consider and act upon any other matter which may properly come before the Annual Meeting or any adjourned session thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has fixed the close of business on June 12, 2017 as the record date for determining the Stockholders entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, only Stockholders of record at the close of business on June 12, 2017 will be entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting or any adjournments thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: /s/ Stephen C. McEvoy Stephen C. McEvoy, Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Danvers, Massachusetts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR VOTE IS IMPORTANT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to vote by proxy even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your proxy via the internet or by telephone by following the instructions on your Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or, if you received a printed copy of your proxy materials, on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a printed copy of your proxy materials, you may also vote by mail by signing, dating and returning your proxy card in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting now will not limit your right to change your vote or to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THE AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS FOR THE ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS TO BE HELD ON AUGUST 9, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year we are taking advantage of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Notice and Access rule, which allows corporate issuers to furnish their proxy materials on the internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we are mailing to our Stockholders, a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice) in place of a paper copy of our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice contains instructions on how to access the proxy materials electronically and how to submit your proxy via the internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice also contains instructions on how to request a paper copy of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process will result in significant savings in printing and mailing costs and will help the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement and our 2017 Annual Report are available on our website at http://www.abiomed.com/proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Note: Our website does not have cookies that identify visitors to the site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ABIOMED, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT FOR THE ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS To be held on August 9, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement is furnished in connection with the solicitation of proxies by and on behalf of our Board of Directors for use at our Annual Meeting of Stockholders (Annual Meeting) to be held at the Mandarin Oriental, 776 Boylston Street, Boston, Massachusetts 02199 on August 9, 2017 at 8:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time and at any adjournment or adjournments thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are a Delaware corporation and our principal executive offices are located at 22 Cherry Hill Drive, Danvers, Massachusetts 01923.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will bear the cost of solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of our officers and employees may solicit proxies by correspondence, telephone or in person, without extra compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may also pay to banks, brokers, nominees and other fiduciaries their reasonable charges and expenses incurred in forwarding proxy material to their principals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is expected that this Proxy Statement and the accompanying proxy will be made available to our Stockholders on or about June 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are first sending the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice), or this Proxy Statement, the Companys 2017 Annual Report and proxy card to Stockholders on or about June 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have fixed the close of business on June 12, 2017 as the record date for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only Stockholders of record at the close of business on the record date will be entitled to receive notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of June 12, 2017, there were outstanding and entitled to vote 44,064,072 shares of our common stock, $0.01 par value per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our by-laws require that a majority in interest of all stock issued, outstanding and entitled to vote at a meeting shall constitute a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will be counted as present or represented for purposes of determining the existence of a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-vote occurs when a broker or nominee holding shares for a beneficial owner does not vote on a proposal because the broker or nominee does not have discretionary voting power and has not received instructions from the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only Stockholders of record of shares of the Companys common stock at the close of business on the record date, or their designated proxies, are entitled to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares in street name (i.e., your shares are held in an account maintained by a bank, broker or other nominee), then you should bring proof of beneficial ownership as of the record date, such as an account statement reflecting your stock ownership as of the record date, a copy of the voting instruction form provided by your broker, bank or other nominee, or other similar evidence of ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a representative or proxyholder of an entity that owns common stock of the Company, you must present evidence that you are the entitys authorized representative or proxyholder, and, if the entity is a street name owner, proof of the entitys beneficial ownership as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reserve the right to limit the number of representatives who may attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each attendee will be asked to present valid government-issued photo identification, such as a drivers license or passport, before being admitted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cameras, recording devices, and other electronic devices are prohibited at the meeting, and attendees may be subject to security inspections and other security precautions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For safety and security reasons, we will be unable to admit anyone who does not present proper identification, proof of ownership or legal proxy, or refuses to comply with our security procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can find directions to the Annual Meeting at http://www.mandarinoriental.com/boston/hotel/hotel-directions/.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 1 (election of directors) requires the affirmative vote of a plurality of the votes cast by holders of our common stock entitled to vote thereon, provided that a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we have adopted a majority voting policy that is applicable in uncontested elections of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the plurality standard will determine whether a director nominee is elected, but our majority voting policy will further require that the number of votes cast for a director must exceed the number of votes withheld from the director or the director must submit his or her resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and Nominating Committee would then consider whether to recommend that the Board accept or reject the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Corporate GovernanceMajority Voting and Director Resignations below for additional details.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2 (the advisory vote on executive compensation), Proposal No. 3 (the advisory vote on the frequency of future Stockholder advisory votes on executive compensation), and Proposal No. 4 (ratification of the appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm) each requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by holders of our common stock entitled to vote thereon, provided that a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will not be included in calculating the number of votes cast on Proposal No. 2, Proposal No. 3, or Proposal No. 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes will be tabulated by Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AT THE ANNUAL MEETING, YOUR SHARES WILL BE VOTED AS YOU INSTRUCT, OR, IN THE ABSENCE OF SUCH INSTRUCTION, FOR THE NOMINEES FOR DIRECTOR (PROPOSAL NO. 1), FOR THE APPROVAL OF THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS (PROPOSAL NO. 2), FOR THE EVERY (1) YEAR OPTION FOR THE PROPOSAL ON THE FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION (PROPOSAL NO. 3) AND FOR THE RATIFICATION OF THE APPOINTMENT OF OUR INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM (PROPOSAL NO. 4).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IF ANY OTHER MATTERS PROPERLY COME BEFORE THE MEETING, THE SHARES REPRESENTED BY THE PROXY WILL BE VOTED BY THE HOLDERS OF THE PROXIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THEIR BEST JUDGMENT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE PROXY MAY BE REVOKED AT ANY TIME PRIOR TO EXERCISE BY FILING WITH OUR SECRETARY A WRITTEN REVOCATION, BY EXECUTING A PROXY WITH A LATER DATE, OR BY ATTENDING AND VOTING AT THE MEETING.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 1 ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors currently consists of seven directors and is divided into three classes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to these classes as Class I, Class II and Class III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of one class of directors expires each year at the Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director also continues to serve as a director until his or her successor is duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year, the term of the Class I directors, which includes Ms. Dorothy E. Puhy, Mr. Paul G. Thomas and Mr. Christopher D. Van Gorder, expires at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has nominated each of Ms. Dorothy E. Puhy, Mr. Paul G. Thomas and Mr. Christopher D. Van Gorder to serve as a Class I director for a three year term until the 2020 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, or until his or her successor has been duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of Ms. Puhy and Mr. Thomas was most recently elected by our Stockholders as a Class I director at our Annual Meeting of Stockholders in August 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 8, 2016, our Board of Directors appointed Mr. Van Gorder as a Class I director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Executive Officers and Directors for further information about Ms. Puhy, Mr. Thomas and Mr. Van Gorder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee at the time of the Annual Meeting is unable or unwilling to serve or is otherwise unavailable for election, and our Board of Directors designates another nominee, the persons named as proxies will vote the proxy for such substitute, if any.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has no reason to believe that any of the proposed nominees will be unable or unwilling to serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposed nominees are not being nominated pursuant to any arrangement or understanding with any person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the election of Ms. Dorothy E. Puhy, Mr. Paul G. Thomas and Mr. Christopher D. Van Gorder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 2 ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, which was enacted in July 2010, requires that we provide our Stockholders with the opportunity to vote to approve, on a non-binding, advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to this non-binding advisory vote as the say on pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this vote is not binding on us, we value the opinion of our Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors and Compensation Committee will carefully consider the outcome of the vote as we make future decisions on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described under the heading Executive Compensation, our compensation programs are designed to attract and retain and reward our executive officers by offering compensation that is competitive with peer organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation consists of a mixture of cash payments and equity incentives, which we believe align our executive compensation with our Stockholder objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review our compensation policies annually with the help of compensation consultants to ensure that our policies meet market expectations and are fair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to carefully review the Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 18 of this Proxy Statement for a discussion of the factors underlying the structure of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking you to indicate your support for the compensation of our named executive officers as described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote on this proposal is not intended to address any specific element of compensation but rather relates to the overall compensation of our named executive officers, as described in this Proxy Statement pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K (including in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables and accompanying narrative disclosures).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, as required pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, we ask our Stockholders to vote in favor of the following resolution at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Stockholders of ABIOMED, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: APPROVE, on an advisory basis, the compensation paid to the named executive officers, as disclosed in the Companys Proxy Statement for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and accompanying narrative disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the approval of the compensation of our named executive officers, as disclosed in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 3 ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF FUTURE VOTES ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company asks that you indicate how frequently the Company should hold future Stockholder advisory votes on executive compensation, such as Proposal 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting on this Proposal 3, you may indicate whether you would prefer an advisory vote on executive compensation once every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, you may abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that having an advisory vote on executive compensation EVERY (1) YEAR will be a meaningful and effective way to use this method of gathering feedback on the Companys executive compensation philosophy, policies, and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has held a Stockholder advisory vote on executive compensation every year since 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has found that such vote provides a clear and simple means for Stockholders to provide direct feedback to the Company regarding its compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed in the Proxy Statement, consistent with the Companys practice of seeking input from, and engaging in discussions with, the Companys Stockholders on corporate governance matters and the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board is making a recommendation with respect to this proposal, Stockholders are not voting to approve or disapprove the Boards recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, Stockholders are being asked to specify one of the four choices for this proposal indicated on the proxy card: one year, two years, three years or abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board will review the voting results in their entirety and take them into consideration when making future decisions regarding the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the option of once EVERY (1) YEAR as the frequency with which Stockholders will be provided an advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 4 RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF OUR INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Nasdaq Stock Market, the appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm is the direct responsibility of our Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although ratification by our Stockholders of this appointment is not required by law, our Board of Directors believes that seeking Stockholder ratification is a good practice, which provides Stockholders an avenue to express their views on this important matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee, comprising solely independent directors, has reappointed Deloitte & Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that Stockholders vote to ratify the appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our Stockholders do not ratify the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP, the Audit Committee may reconsider its decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In any case, the Audit Committee may, in its discretion, appoint a new independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if it believes that such a change would be in the best interest of the Company and its Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that representatives of Deloitte & Touche LLP will be present at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They will have an opportunity to make a statement if they wish and will be available to respond to appropriate questions from Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the proposal to ratify the appointment by our Audit Committee of Deloitte & Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm

sentences.text: (4) Member of the Governance and Nominating Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) Member of the Regulatory and Compliance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is divided into three classes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of one class of directors expires each year at our Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director also continues to serve as a director until his or her successor is duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Puhy, Mr. Thomas and Mr. Van Gorder currently serve as Class I directors; their term of office expires at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Rose and Ms. Rivet currently serve as Class II directors; their term of office expires at the 2018 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Minogue and Sutter currently serve as Class III directors; their term of office expires at the 2019 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are appointed by, and serve at the discretion of, our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no family relationships among our directors and executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Michael R. Minogue has served as our Chief Executive Officer, President and a director since April 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2005, he was appointed Chairman of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining us, Mr. Minogue had a twelve-year career at General Electric, or GE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most recently, Mr. Minogue was Vice President and General Manager of Americas Sales and Marketing for GE Medical Systems Information Technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1997 to 2004, Mr. Minogue held various positions at GE, including General Manager for the Global Positron Emission Technology Business, General Manager, Americas Cardiology & IT Sales and General Manager, Global Installed Base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining GE, Mr. Minogue served on active duty for four years as an infantry officer in the U.S. Army and received multiple awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Minogue received his Bachelor of Science in Engineering Management from the United States Military Academy at West Point and his Master of Business Administration from the University of Chicago.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Minogue currently serves on the Board of Directors of the Advanced Medical Technology Association and also serves as a Manager on the Board of Managers of Bioventus LLC, a strategic partnership between EW Healthcare Partners and Smith & Nephew plc, a global medical technology business based in the United Kingdom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Minogue is also the Chair of the Board of Directors of the Medical Device Innovation Consortium, a public-private partnership created with the objective of advancing medical device regulatory science.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was formerly on the Board of Directors of LifeCell Corporation, which was acquired by Kinetic Concepts, Inc. in May 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Eric A. Rose has served as a director since August 2014 and previously served as a director from May 2007 to January 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He serves as Executive Chairman of SIGA Technologies, Inc., a developer of anti-viral drugs directed at potential agents of bioterror that filed voluntary proceedings under Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy Code in September 2014 and exited from bankruptcy protection in April 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Rose served from 2007 to 2016 as Executive Vice President for Life Sciences at MacAndrews & Forbes and Chief Executive Officer of SIGA Technologies, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Rose chaired the Department of Health Evidence & Policy at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine from 2008 to 2012, where he now serves as professor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1994 to 2007, he was Surgeon-in-Chief at New York-Presbyterian Hospital/Columbia and Chairman of the Department of Surgery at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A heart surgeon, researcher and entrepreneur, Dr. Rose helped grow Columbias Department of Surgery over the past 25 years while investigating, managing and developing complex medical technologies such as heart transplantation and new approaches to Alzheimers disease and bioterrorism.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has authored or co-authored more than 300 scientific publications and has received more than $25 million in NIH support for his research.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Rose pioneered heart transplantation in children, performing the first successful pediatric heart transplant in 1984, and has investigated many alternatives to heart transplantation, including cross-species transplantation and man-made heart pumps.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He received both his undergraduate and medical degrees from Columbia University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that Dr. Roses distinguished work as a heart surgeon and researcher, his work as an entrepreneur in our industry and his executive level industry experience qualify him to serve as a member of our Board of Directors.

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer and Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors does not have a formal policy regarding whether the same person should serve as both the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board and believes that it should retain the flexibility to make this determination in the manner it believes will provide the most appropriate leadership for the Company from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board is elected annually by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, our Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Minogue, serves as Chairman of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2005, our Board of Directors designated Dorothy Puhy as its first Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The position of Lead Director is to be held by one of our independent directors and carries with it responsibilities beyond those of the other directors, ncluding but not limited to: organizing and chairing sessions with our independent directors; working with the Compensation Committee to set performance goals for our Chief Executive Officer and to evaluate the Chief Executive Officers performance for the prior year; working with the Chairman to formulate the agenda for Board meetings; acting as a liaison between the Chairman and the Board of Directors; and leading with the Chief Executive Officer an annual discussion of succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has determined that, with the exception of Mr. Minogue, who is our Chief Executive Officer and President, all of the members of our Board of Directors are independent directors under the applicable rules of the Nasdaq Stock Market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has also determined that each member of our Audit Committee, Compensation Committee and Governance and Nominating Committee is an independent director under the rules of the Nasdaq Stock Market applicable to such committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeannine M. Rivet is an employee of UnitedHealth Group, affiliates of which provide reimbursement in certain instances to hospitals who purchase our products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect such affiliates to continue to provide reimbursement for our products in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Christopher D. Van Gorder is Chief Executive Officer of Scripps Health, which purchased $1,602,025 of our products during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect Scripps Health will continue to purchase our products in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considered each of these relationships and has determined that the independence of each of Ms. Rivet and Mr. Van Gorder is not affected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at Annual Meeting of Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our policy that, to the extent reasonably practicable, Directors should attend our Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our Directors who were serving on our Board at the time of our 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders attended the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors, as a whole has responsibility for risk oversight, with reviews of certain areas being conducted by the relevant Board of Directors Committees that report on their deliberations to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The oversight responsibility of the Board of Directors and its committees is enabled by management reporting to the Board of Directors about the identification, assessment and management of critical risks and managements risk mitigation strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our Board of Directors ability to discharge its risk oversight is enhanced by the service of our Chief Executive Officer as Chairman of the Board of Directors and by our institution of the role of Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors and its Committees oversee risks associated with their respective principal areas of focus, as summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Primary Areas of Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic, financial and execution risks and exposures associated with the annual operating plan, budget and longer term strategic plan; litigation and regulatory exposures and other current matters that may present material risk to our operations, plans, prospects or reputation; acquisitions and divestitures; and senior management succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risks and exposures associated with financial matters, particularly financial reporting, tax, accounting, disclosure, audit oversight, internal control over financial reporting, financial policies, investment guidelines and credit and liquidity matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risks and exposures relating to our corporate governance and director succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: programs and arrangements, including incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risks and exposures associated with our compliance with regulatory and other applicable laws, rules and regulations governing our development, approval and sale of Class III medical device products, both in the U.S. and internationally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors held four meetings during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017 and acted by written consent two times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our directors attended at least 75% of the aggregate number of meetings of the Board of Directors and Committees of which he or she was a member held during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings of Independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independent directors are expected to meet without management present at least twice per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017, the independent directors held four (4) meetings without management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has an Audit Committee, which is currently composed of Dorothy E. Puhy (Chair), Eric A. Rose and Jeannine M. Rivet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has determined that all members of the Audit Committee are financially sophisticated within the meaning of the Nasdaq listing standards and our Board of Directors has also determined that Ms. Puhy, who serves as Chair of the Audit Committee, qualifies as an Audit Committee financial expert within the meaning of the applicable SEC rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The responsibilities of our Audit Committee are detailed in our Audit Committee charter, a copy of which is available through the Our CompanyCorporate Governance section of our website, located at www.abiomed.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation and oversight of the work of our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committees responsibilities include reviewing the adequacy and effectiveness of accounting and financial controls, reviewing our financial reporting practices, meeting with our independent accountants to review the results of the annual
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: audit and quarterly reviews and receiving and reviewing the response of management to any management letter or report from the independent accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017, the Audit Committee held six meetings and did not act by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee is currently composed of Paul G. Thomas (Chair), Jeannine M. Rivet and Martin P. Sutter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Director, Dorothy E. Puhy, participates in meetings of the Compensation Committee as described above under Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The responsibilities of the Compensation Committee are detailed in our Compensation Committee charter, a copy of which is available through the Our CompanyCorporate Governance section of our website, located at www.abiomed.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing our compensation philosophy and major compensation programs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing annually our executive compensation program;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishing the compensation for our Chief Executive Officer and approving the compensation of our executive officers (which is a group broader than our named executive officers);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determining the persons to whom equity awards, including both incentive stock options and non-qualified stock options, restricted stock and restricted stock units will be granted (other than to the extent that the grant of options or full value awards has been delegated by the committee to the Special Stock Award Committee); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adopting rules and making other determinations with respect to the administration of our equity incentive plans, employee stock purchase plan and 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017, the Compensation Committee held five meetings and acted by written consent three times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance and Nominating Committee Meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance and Nominating Committee is currently composed of Martin P. Sutter (Chair), Paul G. Thomas and Christopher D. Van Gorder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The responsibilities of the Governance and Nominating Committee are detailed in our Governance and Nominating Committee charter, a copy of which is available through the Our CompanyCorporate Governance section of our website, located at www.abiomed.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and Nominating Committee is responsible for leading the search for individuals qualified to become members of our Board of Directors, including the review of candidates recommended by our Stockholders, recommending to the Board of Directors the composition of each committee of the Board of Directors and reviewing and monitoring the succession plan for the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017, the Governance and Nominating Committee held four meetings and did not act by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulatory and Compliance Committee Meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Regulatory and Compliance Committee is currently composed of Christopher D. Van Gorder (Chair), Dorothy Puhy and Paul G. Thomas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The responsibilities of the Regulatory and Compliance Committee are detailed in our Regulatory and Compliance Committee charter, a copy of which is available through Our Company Corporate Governance section of our website, located at www.abiomed.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Regulatory and Compliance Committee receives regular reports from the Companys Chief Compliance Officer and is responsible for assisting the Companys Board of Directors with the oversight of significant healthcare related regulatory and compliance issues by overseeing, evaluating and monitoring the Companys compliance policies, standards, procedures, systems and initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Regulatory and Compliance Committee further provides recommendations, reports and guidance to the Board of Directors regarding the Companys compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017, the Regulatory and Compliance Committee held four meetings and did not act by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualification Standards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have any specific, delineated qualifications for the nomination of director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Governance and Nominating Committee does take into account a number of factors, qualifications and skills
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates for membership to our Board of Directors should be individuals who possess the highest personal and professional ethics and integrity and have demonstrated professional achievement and leadership capabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and Nominating Committee seeks candidates with a broad diversity of knowledge, experience and demonstrated expertise in an area or areas of importance to our Company, such as management, finance, marketing, technology, medicine, human resources, public policy and law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance and Nominating Committee also considers traditional diversity factors such as race or gender but has no formal policy, guidelines or procedures with respect to consideration of diversity in the nominating process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All candidates must evidence a commitment to devote the substantial time and energy required of productive Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Voting and Director Resignations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted a majority voting policy for uncontested elections of directors (elections in which the number of nominees for election does not exceed the number of directors to be elected).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the policy, the Board of Directors will nominate for election or re-election only candidates who have tendered an irrevocable resignation that will be effective if in an uncontested election of directors, the nominee for director receives a greater number of votes withheld from his or her election than votes for his or her election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If such an outcome were to occur, the Governance and Nominating Committee must promptly consider the resignation offer and recommend to the Board of Directors whether to accept or reject it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors then must act on the Governance and Nominating Committees recommendation within 90 days following certification of the Stockholder vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may consider any factors or information it deems relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Governance and Nominating Committee and the Board of Directors may consider a range of alternatives in determining what action to take, including but not limited to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) accepting the resignation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) rejecting the resignation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) rejecting the resignation to allow the director to remain on the Board of Directors but agreeing that the director will not be nominated for re-election upon expiration of the directors term; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) deferring acceptance of the directors resignation until the Board of Directors can find a replacement director with the necessary qualifications to fill the vacancy that accepting the resignation would create.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Emeritus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective as of the 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders on August 10, 2016, the Board named Dr. W. Gerald Austen as Director Emeritus of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to serving as Director Emeritus, Dr. Austen served on the Board of Directors for 31 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exchange for his service as Director Emeritus, Dr. Austen receives an annual cash retainer equal to the retainer received by other directors, and an additional annual retainer of $5,000 for his participation in meetings of the Governance and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Dr. Austen is eligible for equity grants on the same basis as non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with Dr. Austens transition to Director Emeritus, his restricted stock awards that were outstanding and unvested as of the expiration of his term as a director on August 10, 2016, continue to remain outstanding and eligible to vest according to their terms so long as Dr. Austen continues to serve as Director Emeritus of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Conduct and Compliance Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our directors, officers and employees are expected to act ethically, legally and with integrity at all times and are obligated to comply with our Code of Conduct and Compliance Policy, as well as our other policies and standards of conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of our Code of Conduct and Compliance Policy is available on our website at http://investors.abiomed.com/corporate-governance.cfm and may also be obtained, without charge, by written request to our Chief Compliance Officer at ABIOMED, Inc., 22 Cherry Hill Drive, Danvers, Massachusetts 01923.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications with Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested persons may send communications to the directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Written correspondence should be addressed to the director or directors in care of the Chief Compliance Officer at ABIOMED, Inc., 22 Cherry Hill Drive, Danvers, Massachusetts 01923.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested persons may also send email to the directors at directors@abiomed.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Complaints or concerns relating to our financial reporting, accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing will be referred to the Chair of our Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other communications may be referred to the directors as a group, or to an individual director, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to May 24, 2016, each of our non-employee directors was eligible to receive an annual retainer of $45,000 or an equivalent value of our common stock, determined as of the date of grant, at the individuals option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective May 24, 2016, each of our non-employee directors became eligible to receive an annual retainer of $50,000 or an equivalent value of our common stock, determined as of the date of grant, at the individuals option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our non-employee directors also receives an annual award of restricted stock units covering the equivalent of approximately $200,000 in shares of our common stock, which will vest on the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the first anniversary of the date of grant and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the next annual meeting of Stockholders following the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Director receives an additional $25,000 annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair of our Audit Committee receives an additional $20,000 annually, the Chair of our Compensation Committee receives an additional $15,000 annually, and the Chair of our Nominating and Governance Committee and the Chair of our Regulatory and Compliance Committee, each receive an additional $10,000 annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, members of our Audit Committee each receive an additional $10,000 annually, members of our Compensation Committee each receive an additional $7,500 annually, and members of our Nominating and Governance Committee each receive an additional $5,000 annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our Board of Directors or any of its Committees has an unusually large number of meetings in any one year, our Board of Directors has the authority to pay each director an additional $1,200 for attendance at meetings of our Board of Directors and $1,000 for attendance at meetings of Committees of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, for an unusually large number of meetings in any one year, our Board of Directors has the authority to pay $1,000 to the Chair of our Audit Committee for attendance at meetings of our Audit Committee, $1,000 to the Chair of our Compensation Committee for attendance at meetings of our Compensation Committee, and $1,300 to the Chair of our Nominating and Governance Committee for attendance at meetings of our Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We made no such additional payments in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of May 15, 2017, the annual cash retainer payable to each non-employee director had not changed for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have stock ownership guidelines that require each director to beneficially own shares of our common stock with the equivalent value, as of the acquisition date, of at least three times the annual cash retainer for a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director is required to achieve such stock ownership requirements by the later of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Annual Meeting or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) five years from the date the person first became a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our non-employee directors other than Ms. Rivet and Mr. Van Gorder, who joined our Board of Directors in February 2016, have met the stock ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is currently our policy to grant restricted stock units equal to $250,000 of our common stock upon the appointment of a new non-employee director, which award will vest annually over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also currently have a non-employee director retirement policy that provides for the accelerated vesting of all stock options, restricted stock units and other equity awards held by a non-employee director if he or she permanently ceases his or her service on our Board of Directors by reason of death, disability, or the non-employee directors retirement following at least five years of service and so long as his or her age plus years of service equals or exceeds 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee consists of Paul G. Thomas (Chair), Jeannine M. Rivet and Martin P. Sutter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of our Compensation Committee is a former or current officer or employee of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Director, Dorothy E. Puhy, participates in meetings of the Compensation Committee as described above under Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Minogue, while not a member of the Compensation Committee, makes recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding the compensation of executive officers other than himself, including the awards of stock options and restricted stock units, and often participates in the Compensation Committees deliberations but does not vote on such matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our executive officers serves as a member of the Board of Directors or Compensation Committee of any entity that has one or more executive officers serving as members of our Board of Directors or Compensation Committee.

sentences.text: Certain Relationships and Related-Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no material related-person transactions in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Audit Committee of our Board of Directors is responsible for reviewing any proposed related-party transaction, as defined under the rules of the Nasdaq Stock Market, and, if appropriate, approving such transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the conflict of interest section in our Code of Conduct and Compliance Policy provides that specified conflict of interest transactions are prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Examples of these conflict of interest transactions include serving as a director, officer or employee of or consultant to any competitor or any entity that does business with us or having a substantial undisclosed direct or indirect interest in any entity that does business with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the foregoing, we have no established policies or procedures, written or otherwise, for the review, approval or ratification of transactions with related persons.

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes the material elements of our compensation programs as they relate to our executive officers who are listed in the following compensation tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the remainder of this Compensation Discussion and Analysis, we refer to these executive officers as named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aside from focusing on compensation-related tables and footnotes, this narrative also describes other arrangements and actions taken since March 31, 2017 to the extent such discussion enhances the understanding of our executive compensation for fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees and administers our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary objectives of the executive compensation program are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to attract, retain and motivate key executives, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to reward superior financial, strategic and operational performance that is achieved in a manner consistent with our team- oriented values and corporate goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation of our named executive officers in fiscal 2017 consisted of base salary, cash bonus, the grant of equity incentives and participation in benefit plans generally available to all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The largest component of our named executive officers annual compensation program is equity incentives, followed by, depending on the individual, cash bonuses or base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this practice to be consistent with our philosophy of tying executive compensation to our performance, while also rewarding our named executive officers for exceeding expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of March 31, 2017, the outstanding equity incentive awards held by our named executive officers consisted of stock options, and time-based and performance-based restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table shows a list of our named executive officers, along with their positions in the Company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officer    Position Michael R. Minogue   President, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board Michael J. Tomsicek   Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer David M. Weber   Chief Operating Officer William J. Bolt   Senior Vice President, Global Quality, Regulatory and Clinical Operations Michael G. Howley   Vice President and General Manager, Global Sales
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers are assessed and rated annually on a scale of 1 (low) to 4 (high) on the basis of demonstrated results relative to pre-established goals, as well as subjective leadership qualities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rating that a named executive officer receives each year generally has a direct and material impact on the cash bonus, stock option and restricted stock unit grants that such officer receives, as well as his annual increase in base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of 2016 Say-On-Pay Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, we continued to receive substantial support for our executive compensation program, with approximately 89% of the votes cast (excluding broker non-votes) for approval of our annual say-on-pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee believes these results convey positive Stockholder support for its decisions on executive compensation and that the Companys executive compensation program is aligned with our stated compensation philosophy and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is committed to regularly reviewing, assessing and, when appropriate, adjusting the Companys compensation programs based on feedback from our Stockholders, best practices, and compensation trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Compensation Committee continues to evaluate the performance-based restricted stock unit component of our executive compensation program, which it currently believes reflects and reinforces our pay-for-performance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2017, the Compensation Committee reviewed the best practices, compensation trends and the results from our say-on-pay proposal at last years Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee was satisfied that our existing compensation programs further our pay-for-performance philosophy, and, accordingly, did not recommend any significant adjustments for fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of Fiscal 2017 Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2017 was a strong year for ABIOMED, with the Company succeeding on critical metrics such as the number of supported patients, regulatory approvals, revenue, profits, market capitalization, publications, expanding our international business, and solidifying our position with respect to clinical guidelines and intellectual property.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of our fiscal 2017 performance include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) pre-market approval in April 2016 of the Impella 2.5 , Impella CP , Impella 5.0 , and Impella LD  heart pumps to provide treatment of ongoing cardiogenic shock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Received Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency, or PMDA, approval in September 2016 from the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor & Welfare for the Impella 2.5 and Impella 5.0 heart pumps to provide treatment of drug-resistant acute heart failure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expanded FDA approval in December 2016 of the Impella CP device to treat elective and urgent patients undergoing high risk percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintained our debt-free balance sheet and grew cash and marketable securities by $64.0 million to $277.1 million at March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Launch of the Impella Quality Assurance Program in March 2017, the largest database of real-world, observational data concerning the treatment of high-risk PCI and cardiogenic shock patients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant investment in capital expansion of manufacturing and office space in U.S., Germany and Japan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating margin of 20.2% in fiscal 2017 compared to 19.8% in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total revenue for fiscal 2017 of $445.3 million, an increase of 35% over fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2017, GAAP net income was $52.1 million, or $1.17 per diluted share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Detailed in the balance of this Compensation Discussion and Analysis section is the effect of this exceptional performance on the pay of our NEOs for fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Consultants and Peer Groups
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist us in making compensation decisions in fiscal 2017, including salary increases and our decisions about equity incentive compensation, we continued to be advised through April 2017, and then on an as-needed, transitional basis through June 2017, by the compensation consultant Radford, an Aon Hewitt Companya division of Aon Corporation (Radford), who has been engaged by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in April, 2017, the Compensation Committee engaged Willis Towers Watson (Willis) as its compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We evaluated peer group data provided to us by our compensation consultant for comparative purposes for fiscal 2017, and decided on the following peer group of 19 companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abaxis Global Diagnostics    Haemonetics Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Natus M Align Technology    Hologic Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NuVasiv Cantel Medical Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ICU Medical Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NxStag CONMED Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Inogen Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Penumb DexCom, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Integra Life Sciences   ResMed Edwards Life Sciences Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Masimo Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Globus Medical, Inc    Merit Medical Systems, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These companies were included in our peer group because they are all in the healthcare equipment and supplies industry and were chosen based on having similar employee size, revenues, and market capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also looked at competitive market data from the Radford Global Life Sciences Survey, effective as of January 15, 2017, focusing on U.S. publicly traded medical device companies with annual revenue between $150 million and $2.0 billion, a median headcount of 1,200, and median annual revenue of $396 million, to compare market compensation levels for each element of our compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally strive for base salaries to be competitive with the market represented by our peer group and broader market survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based compensation consisting of a cash bonus and equity incentives provides an opportunity for total compensation to exceed the market should performance warrant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the target performance metrics for our annual cash bonuses and performance-based equity awards are rigorous goals that will only be achieved with strong performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay each of our named executive officers a base salary to provide a baseline level of compensation that is both competitive with the external market and commensurate with each employees past performance, experience, responsibilities and skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally target base salaries for our named executive officers around the 50  percentile of our external market peers, as described above, and then make adjustments based on the factors described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer recommended (for named executive officers other than himself) and the Compensation Committee approved base salary increases for fiscal 2017 for all of our named executive officers, other than Mr. Minogue, in the range of 3% to 8%, based on performance and the prior years salary relative to external market compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our named executive officers other than Mr. Minogue, the percentage increase directly corresponded to the named executive officers overall performance ranking of 1 to 4 (as described in more detail under Cash Bonus below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors taken into account for Mr. Minogues 3% base salary increase included a review of peer group and survey data and an assessment of his and the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2018, our Compensation Committee recently approved increases to the base salary of all of our named executive officers in the range of 3% to 11%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Bonus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain an annual cash bonus program, the purpose of which is to motivate and reward the attainment of our annual financial, strategic and operational goals as well as the attainment of individual goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each named executive officer, other than Mr. Minogue, 70% of the executives fiscal 2017 target bonus opportunity was based on achievement of corporate goals related to the executives responsibility, and 30% was based on a subjective assessment of the executives overall individual performance, based on factors including professional competency, work efforts, leadership, flexibility, commitment to the Companys Code of Ethics, and integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has complete discretion in determining Mr. Minogues annual bonus, which historically has been determined based on Company performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000815094/000119312517211805/d392649ddef14a.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEF 14A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company performance goals are developed by our Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Minogue, in consultation with other members of senior management and presented to our Board of Directors for review on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual performance goals for our named executive officers, other than Mr. Minogue, are established by Mr. Minogue and discussed with the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual cash bonus awards can range from zero to more than target levels, depending on the degree to which the Company and the executive achieve the performance goals for the particular year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on Company and individual performance against specified goals, the assessment of an executives leadership, and an executives base salary relative to market, total cash compensation (salary and bonus) is generally targeted above the market represented by our peer group and broader market survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this positioning is justified given the rigorous performance goals under the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all named executive officers, annual cash bonus opportunities for fiscal 2017 were targeted at a level that represented a meaningful portion of each executives current base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2017, target bonus opportunities for our named executive officers were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officer    Target Bonus Opportunity as % of Base Salary Mr. Minogue    120% All other Named Executive Officers    60%  70%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2017 bonuses, the goals selected were intended to strike a balance among fiscal, strategic and operational performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance goals varied depending on each executives duties and responsibilities and were weighted according to the importance of the goal to our overall strategic objectives for the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company performance goals for fiscal 2017 included revenue growth, as described below, improving customer satisfaction, and patient outcomes with product quality, training and clinical support, accelerating education and awareness of protected PCI and cardiogenic shock treatment, executing on clinical and regulatory processes to launch Impella in Japan, optimize global cVAD Registry  and complete Impella RP FDA pre-market approval application, and maintaining regulatory compliance and operational predictability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the selected goals were challenging for the management team and the Company to achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the challenging nature and the selection of performance goals most effectively align management incentives with enhancement of long-term Stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of each fiscal year, each named executive officer is evaluated on a scale of 1 through 4 for each Company goal and is evaluated on a scale of 1 through 4 based on a subjective assessment of his individual performance, as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The revenue targets used in the rating system for all named executive officers for fiscal 2017 ranged from a rating of 1 for revenue below $428.0 million (growth of less than 30% over fiscal 2016), a rating of 2 for revenue of $428.0 million to $445.0 million (growth of 30% to less than 35% over fiscal 2016), a rating of 3 for revenue of $445.0 million to $461.0 million (growth of 35% to less than 40% over fiscal 2016) and a rating of 4 for revenue above $461.0 million (growth of 40% or more over fiscal 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These goals are generally set so that the expected outcome would be a 2 or 3 rating, with a 4 rating being very difficult to achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2017, an average rating (with Company performance goals weighted at 70%, and individual goals weighted at 30%) of 2 or 3 resulted in a recommendation of 100% or 110%, respectively, of bonus target for our named executive officers other than Mr. Minogue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These recommendations, however, are not formulaically determined at the beginning of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rating system is a method for determining fiscal year performance against set goals, but the bonus payments are still discretionary (i.e., while performance ratings and actual bonus payouts are correlated, the ultimate bonus amounts are based on a subjective review of Company and individual performance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonuses for named executive officers other than the Chief Executive Officer are recommended by Mr. Minogue, but the Compensation Committee has the discretion to alter actual bonus awards from the Chief Executive Officers recommendation, either up or down.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee has complete discretion in determining Mr. Minogues annual bonus, which historically has been determined based on Company performance.

sentences.text: Equity Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer equity incentives to the majority of employees to foster a culture of ownership, align compensation with Stockholder interests and promote long-term retention and affiliation with the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee determines the types and sizes of awards to be used for delivering such incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, the Compensation Committee considers the ability of each type and size of award to achieve key compensation objectives (such as employee retention, motivation and attraction), the needs of the business, competitive market practices, dilution and expense constraints, as well as tax and accounting implications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 1998, we have made our annual merit equity grants in conjunction with our annual performance appraisal process, which takes place after the close of our fiscal year, typically in May or June of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishing a consistent annual grant pattern has allowed us to incorporate the results of our internal performance reviews and rankings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The date of each annual merit grant is the date upon which the Compensation Committee approves the individual grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It has been our practice to hold this Compensation Committee meeting after the announcement of year-end results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our historical stock option grant practice, the exercise price of stock options granted as part of the annual merit grant is the closing price of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options granted to new hires are ordinarily granted and priced on a date shortly after the date of hire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further align the interests of our executives with our long-term interests and those of our Stockholders, the Compensation Committee takes a portfolio approach to equity incentive awards targeted in total at approximately the market 75  percentile relative to our peer group and broader market survey data, with a core annual grant targeted at the market 50  percentile split equally between time-vested stock options and time- vested restricted stock units, and a stretch to the market 75  percentile through time- and performance-vested restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee takes this approach because it believes that equity compensation that vests over time, in combination with performance-vesting equity awards that are based on the achievement of revenue targets and other important performance goals (e.g., regulatory approval of our key products), provides strong retention value, incentivizes our executives to achieve key performance goals and aligns their interests with those of our Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
